com.ino.freehost.client

Class RW3270

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ino.freehost.client.RW3270

  • public class RW3270
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a 3270 session to client implementations, and is the main API for creating 3270 applications.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RW3270

        public RW3270(RWTnAction client)
        Default constructor. Assumes Tn3270 model 2 (80 x 24)
        Parameters:
        client - RWTnAction interface used for communicating with the client implementation

      • RW3270

        public RW3270(int modelNumber,
              RWTnAction client)
        Constructor. Sets the model type of the new 3270 object:
        Parameters:
        client - RWTnAction interface used for communicating with the client implementation
        modelNumber - the 3270 model number.
        • 2: 24x80
        • 3: 32x80
        • 4: 43x80
        • 5: 27x132

    • Method Detail

      • getTelnet

        protected RWTelnet getTelnet()

      • getDisplay

        public char[] getDisplay()
        Gets the current screen's display characters. This method is useful for getting the characters necessary for display in the client implementation. It automatically suppresses hidden (password, etc.) fields and null characters.
        Returns:
        The current 3270 screen as an array of characters.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String host,
                    int port,
                    java.lang.String host3270,
                    int port3270,
                    boolean encryption)
        This method attempts to connect this 3270 object to the specified SessionServer and 3270 Host.
        Parameters:
        host - - the hostname or ip address of the SessionServer
        port - - the SessionServer's port
        host3270 - - the hostname or ip address of the 3270 host. (If using SessionServer)
        port3270 - - the port of the 3270 host
        encryption - - True if encryption should be used, false otherwise. IMPORTANT: this setting must match the SessionServer's encryption setting in order to communicate successfully. the current encryption setting of the SessionServer can be obtained by calling >SessionServer<. getEncryption()

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String host,
                    int port)
        This method implements connections directly to a host, bypassing the SessionServer NOTE: connections made in this fashion are not encrypted
        Parameters:
        host - The hostname of the TN3270 host to connect to
        port - The port on which to connect to the TN3270 host

      • getFields

        public java.util.List<RW3270Field> getFields()
        Returns a vector of fields representing the current 3270 screen
        Returns:
        the field Vector

      • waitForNewData

        public void waitForNewData()
        Blocks the currently executing thread until new data arrives from the host This method is useful when using stateless client implementations (i.e. HTTP) or when you're scripting through several 3270 screens. For example:
        ...
        //Set the value of a field and press enter
        RW3270Field.setData("My Data");
        RW3270.enter();
        //Wait for the new screen
        RW3270.waitForNewData();
        myClient.paintScreen()....


        IMPORTANT: This method only blocks until the 3270 engine has received a response from the host and processed it. In the case where the host has sent an EraseAllUnprotected or other Non-Data type command, this method will return normally, even though the DataBuffer (screen) may be empty. Client implementations need to handle any host-specific anomalies such as screen clears, etc.

      • isKeyboardLocked

        public boolean isKeyboardLocked()
        This method is designed to let implementations check to see if the 'keyboard' is currently locked.
        Returns:
        True if the screen is not currently accepting input, False if it is.

      • type

        public void type(int key)
          throws IsProtectedException
        Inserts the specified ASCII character at the current cursor position if the current field is unprotected, and advances the cursor position by one. This is useful for implementations that accept keyboard input directly. For implementations that don't require character-by-character input, use RW3270Field.setData(String data) instead.
        Parameters:
        key - - the keyboard/ASCII number corresponding to the key pressed.
        Throws:
        IsProtectedException - if the current field is protected.
        See Also:
        RW3270Field

      • delete

        public void delete()
            throws IsProtectedException
        Deletes the current character (by setting it to ' ').
        Throws:
        IsProtectedException - if the current field is protected.

        public void backTab()
        This method sets the cursor position to the first character position of the last unprotected field.

      • tab

        public void tab()
        This method advances the cursor position to the first character position of the next unprotected field.

      • backspace

        public void backspace()
               throws IsProtectedException
        Deletes the current character (by setting it to ' ') and decrements the cursor position by one.
        Throws:
        IsProtectedException - if the current field is protected.

      • left

        public void left()
        Moves the cursor position one character to the left, wrapping when necessary. Returns without moving the cursor if the terminal is currently locked.

      • right

        public void right()
        Moves the cursor position one character to the right, wrapping when necessary. Returns without moving the cursor if the terminal is currently locked.

      • up

        public void up()
        Moves the cursor position 'up' one row from it's current position. For example, in an 80-column screen, calling the up() mehtod will decrease the cursor position by 80. This method will 'wrap' from the first row to the last row

      • down

        public void down()
        Moves the cursor position 'down' one row from it's current position. For example, in an 80-column screen, calling the down() mehtod will increase the cursor position by 80. This method will 'wrap' from the last row to the first row

        public void keyFieldMark()

        public void home()

        public void sysreq()
        Executes the sysreq command

      • enter

        public void enter()
        Presses the 'enter' key on the terminal. This sets the AID to ENTER, and fires off a Read Modified command on the current buffer.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String search)
        Searches the current data buffer (screen) for the specified string.
        Parameters:
        search - The string to search the data buffer for.
        Returns:
        true if the string was found, false otherwise.

      • waitFor

        public boolean waitFor(java.lang.String search,
                       int timeout)
        Blocks until the specified string is found in the data buffer (screen) or until the specified timeout is reached. This method is extrememly useful when the host may be sending several screens in response to your request, and you want to block until you reach the response you're waiting for. For example:

        ...
        //Create a RW3270 object

        RW3270 rw = new RW3270(this);

        //Connect to the SessionServer and specify a host

        rw.connect("3.3.88.3", 6870, "hollis.harvard.edu", 23, true);

        //This will block for 30 seconds or until the string
        //H A R V A R D is found. it also returns a boolean to
        //let us check the results

        boolean t = rw.waitFor("H A R V A R D", 30);

        //Now we'll execute two different blocks of code depending
        //on whether our string was found:

        if(t)
        {
        out.print("Got it:");
        out.print(new String(rw.getDisplay()));
        }
        else
        {
        out.print("Didn't get it:");
        out.print(new String(rw.getDisplay()));
        }
        Parameters:
        search - The string to wait for
        timeout - Number of seconds to wait for the search string.
        Returns:
        true if the string was found, false if the timeout was reached without finding it.

        Parameters:

        timeout - in seconds
        Returns:
